trans-unit.source: For historic reasons, pathlib2 still uses bytes to represent file paths internally. Unfortunately, on Windows with Python 2.7, the file system encoder (
trans-unit.target: 由于历史原因,pathlib2 内部仍然使用字节来表示文件路径。遗憾的是,在 Windows 中,Python 2.7 的文件系统编码器 (

trans-unit.source: Issues that occur in this backport, but that do not occur not in the standard Python pathlib module can be submitted on the pathlib2 bug tracker.
trans-unit.target: Issues that occur in this backport, but that do not occur not in the standard Python pathlib module can be submitted on the pathlib2 bug tracker.
面向对象的文件系统路径

trans-unit.source: Standalone releases are available on PyPI: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/pathlib2/
trans-unit.target: Standalone releases are available on PyPI: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/pathlib2/

trans-unit.source: The old pathlib module on bitbucket is in bugfix-only mode. The goal of pathlib2 is to provide a backport of standard pathlib module which tracks the standard library module, so all the newest features of the standard pathlib can be used also on older Python versions.
trans-unit.target: The old pathlib module on bitbucket is in bugfix-only mode. The goal of pathlib2 is to provide a backport of standard pathlib module which tracks the standard library module, so all the newest features of the standard pathlib can be used also on older Python versions.

trans-unit.source: The main development takes place in the Python standard library: see the Python developer’s guide. In particular, new features should be submitted to the Python bug tracker.
trans-unit.target: The main development takes place in the Python standard library: see the Python developer’s guide. In particular, new features should be submitted to the Python bug tracker.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, on Windows with Python 2.7, until this problem is fixed upstream, unfortunately you cannot rely on pathlib2 to support the full unicode range for filenames. See issue #56 for more details.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, on Windows with Python 2.7, until this problem is fixed upstream, unfortunately you cannot rely on pathlib2 to support the full unicode range for filenames. See issue #56 for more details.
